area_name: Roof on Hillside- Army of Darkness Boulder

content.description:
Dark Shadows is the line coming out the left side of the roof. Start in back of cave on a right hand sidepull and a low, left hand, sloper gaston. Get a savage knee scum to reach a horizontal crack on the face. From here, head straight up on crimps and a cool pinch. Could be easier than easier than suggested, needs a repeat.

FA vid

https://youtu.be/Y3Az2t7oaOI
content.location: It climbs the roof on the ridge line and can easily be seen from parking. The easiest way to approach it is via the trail.

content.description:
Army of Darkness has sustained climbing out a horizontal roof: crimps, pinches, slopers, underclings, foot jams, heel toe cams, and lots of tension. I am giving both lines V10, but I’d say Army of Darkness could be harder and

Dark Shadows

a little easier if you know how to knee scum. There is potential for an easier line out the other side of roof, but a fall from the slab could be your last one. Both lines can be done from a “stand” with your left hand around the arete on a blocky sidepull and your right hand on the undercling pinch. That is probably in the V8 range, with the left being easier and the right harder.
content.protection: The landing is pretty good. The problem covers a lot of ground from the back. 4 pads and a blubber was perfect. I shifted all the slabs from the back of the roof to form a landing. A spotter could be helpful for the end of Army of Darkness. A pendulum swing off the cliff band would not be very fun. I fell there a few times and was fine.
content.location: You can see the boulder up on the hillside from the parking. It is a large, square boulder sitting on the edge of the cliff band. You can approach via a deer trail that skirts the hillside above the ditch. It is not super obvious. I would recommend approaching it from the trail.

pathTokens: Roof on Hillside- Army of Darkness Boulder
